analyzer/src/muSC_muPC/MqlArray.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 //
00002 // Tables are kept in arrays of structures.  Each time an element is added, 
00003 // the array size increases according to size_new = N + C*size_old, where N 
00004 // would typically be of order 10 and C would typically be of order 2.  It is
00005 // necessary to copy all values when changing the array size, so it should
00006 // be done fairly infrequently.
00007 //
00008 
00009 #ifndef MQLARRAY
00010 #define MQLARRAY
00011 
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <stdlib.h>
00014 
00015 static const int REALLOC_N = 2;
00016 static const int REALLOC_C = 8;
00017 
00018 template<typename T> class MqlArray
00019 {
00020   public:
00021 
00022   MqlArray() {
00023     fArray = NULL;
00024     fSize = 0;
00025     fLastSize = 0;
00026     fAllocation = 0;
00027     fImmutable = false;
00028   }
00029 
00030   ~MqlArray() {
00031     if(!fImmutable && fArray != NULL) {
00032       delete[] fArray;
00033     }
00034   }
00035 
00036   inline T& operator[] (int i) {
00037     return fArray[i];
00038   }
00039 
00040   inline int next() {
00041     int retval = fSize;
00042     setSize(fSize + 1);
00043     return retval;
00044   }
00045 
00046   inline int size() {
00047     return fSize;
00048   }
00049 
00050   inline void setSize(int size) {
00051     if(size > fAllocation) {
00052       realloc(size);
00053     }
00054     fSize = size;
00055   }
00056 
00057   inline void reset() {
00058 #if 0
00059     if(!fImmutable) {
00060       int nextSize = (int) (fLastSize * 0.9);
00061       fSize = 0;
00062       realloc(nextSize);
00063     }
00064 #endif
00065   }
00066 
00067   inline void finish() {
00068 #if 0
00069     if(!fImmutable) {
00070       fAllocation = 0;
00071       fLastSize = fSize;
00072       fSize = 0;
00073 
00074       if(fArray != NULL) {
00075         delete[] fArray;
00076         fArray = NULL;
00077       }
00078     }
00079 #else
00080     if(!fImmutable) {
00081       fSize = 0;
00082     }
00083 #endif
00084   }
00085 
00086   inline void sort(int (*compar)(const void *, const void *)) {
00087     qsort(fArray, fSize, sizeof(T), compar);
00088   }
00089 
00090   inline bool checkSort(int (*compar)(const void *, const void *)) {
00091     for(int i = 1; i < fSize; i++) {
00092 //      if(compar(&fArray[i-1], &fArray[i]) > 0) {
00093       if(compar(&(*this)[i-1], &(*this)[i]) > 0) {
00094 printf("checkSort: problem at element %d\n", i);
00095         return false;
00096       }
00097     }
00098 
00099     return true;
00100   }
00101 
00102   void realloc(int minSize) {
00103 
00104     int newSize = REALLOC_N*fAllocation + REALLOC_C;
00105 
00106     if(minSize > newSize) {
00107       newSize = minSize;
00108     }
00109 
00110     // make a new array and put it into place
00111     T *oldArray = fArray;
00112     T *newArray = new T[newSize];
00113     fArray = newArray;
00114     fAllocation = newSize;
00115 
00116     // copy the contents and delete the old array
00117     if(oldArray != NULL) {
00118       memcpy(newArray, oldArray, fSize*sizeof(T)); 
00119       memset(newArray+fSize, 0, (newSize-fSize)*sizeof(T));
00120       delete[] oldArray;  
00121     } else {
00122       memset(newArray, 0, (newSize)*sizeof(T));
00123     }
00124   }
00125 
00126   void fromBank(void *pevent, char *bankName) {
00127     fSize = bk_locate(pevent, bankName, (DWORD*) &fArray)
00128              * sizeof(DWORD) / sizeof(T);
00129     if(fArray == NULL)
00130     {
00131       printf("Warning: could not find bank %s\n", bankName);
00132     }
00133     fImmutable = true;
00134   }
00135 
00136   void toBank(void *pevent, char *bankName) {
00137     T *outputArray;
00138     bk_create(pevent, bankName, TID_DWORD, (DWORD*) &outputArray);
00139     memcpy(outputArray, fArray, fSize * sizeof(T));
00140     bk_close(pevent, outputArray + fSize);
00141   }
00142 
00143   private:
00144 
00145   T *fArray;
00146   int fAllocation;
00147   int fSize;
00148   int fLastSize;
00149   bool fImmutable;
00150 };
00151 
00152 #endif
